pullRequest.title: Update help text in commands
pullRequest.bodyText:
Purpose

Update help text in commands

Check List

 Read the Contributing Guide
 Updated Change Log
 Checked Tooling Support (#)
 Added necessary tests

 Unit Tests
 Spec Conformance Tests
 Integration Tests
 Ballerina By Example Tests


 Increased Test Coverage
 Added necessary documentation

 API documentation
 Module documentation in Module.md files
 Ballerina By Examples

commit.message: Update usage text in commands and remove skip-lock flag

beforeCommit.message: Update usage text in commands and remove skip-lock flag

afterCommit.message: Update usage text in commands and remove skip-lock flag

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                   There are three built-in templates named: 'main', 'service' and 'lib''.
          
          
            
                   There are three built-in templates named: 'main', 'service', and 'lib''.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -15,21 +14,18 @@ DESCRIPTION
        If a template is not specified, this command creates a module
        with a 'main' function.
 
-       There are two built-in templates named: 'main' and 'service'.
+       There are three built-in templates named: 'main', 'service' and 'lib''.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                   In that case <template-name> becomes a qualified module name.
          
          
            
                   In that case, <template-name> becomes a qualified module name.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -15,21 +14,18 @@ DESCRIPTION
        If a template is not specified, this command creates a module
        with a 'main' function.
 
-       There are two built-in templates named: 'main' and 'service'.
+       There are three built-in templates named: 'main', 'service' and 'lib''.
 
        You can download templates from Ballerina Central as well.
        In that case <template-name> becomes a qualified module name.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                       Add a module using a predefined template.
          
          
            
                       Add a module using a pre-defined template.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -15,21 +14,18 @@ DESCRIPTION
        If a template is not specified, this command creates a module
        with a 'main' function.
 
-       There are two built-in templates named: 'main' and 'service'.
+       There are three built-in templates named: 'main', 'service' and 'lib''.
 
        You can download templates from Ballerina Central as well.
        In that case <template-name> becomes a qualified module name.
 
-           <org-name>/<module-name>[:<version>]
+           <org-name>/<package-name>[:<version>]
 
 
 OPTIONS
        -t <template-name>, --template <template-name>
            Add a module using a predefined template.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    hello.jar file in the '<project-root>/target/bin' directory.
          
          
            
                    `hello.jar` file in the '<project-root>/target/bin' directory.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -81,20 +69,18 @@ EXAMPLES
        Compile a Ballerina source file and create an executable jar.
           $ ballerina build hello.bal
 
-       Build the 'hello' module. This will generate a hello.jar file
-       in the '<project-root>/target/bin' directory.
-          $ ballerina build hello
+       Build the 'hello' package that has an entry point. This will generate a
+        hello.jar file in the '<project-root>/target/bin' directory.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2,22 +2,19 @@ NAME
        ballerina-test - Run module tests
 
 SYNOPSIS
-       ballerina test [<options>] <module-name> [<config properties>]
-       ballerina test -a | --all [<options>] [--] [<config properties>]
-       ballerina test <balfile> [<config properties>]
+       ballerina test [<options>]
+                      [<ballerina-file-path> | <ballerina-project-directory>] [<config properties>]
 
 
 DESCRIPTION
        Test compiles and executes Ballerina test sources and print a summary of
-       test results. You can execute tests in a module,
-       or an entire Ballerina project.
+       test results. You can execute tests in a Ballerina package or a standalone,

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                          Note that testing single bal files will not work within a Ballerina project.
          
          
            
                          Note that testing single BAL files will not work within a Ballerina project.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2,22 +2,19 @@ NAME
        ballerina-test - Run module tests
 
 SYNOPSIS
-       ballerina test [<options>] <module-name> [<config properties>]
-       ballerina test -a | --all [<options>] [--] [<config properties>]
-       ballerina test <balfile> [<config properties>]
+       ballerina test [<options>]
+                      [<ballerina-file-path> | <ballerina-project-directory>] [<config properties>]
 
 
 DESCRIPTION
        Test compiles and executes Ballerina test sources and print a summary of
-       test results. You can execute tests in a module,
-       or an entire Ballerina project.
+       test results. You can execute tests in a Ballerina package or a standalone,
+       Ballerina file.
     
-       Use 'ballerina test <module-name>' to execute tests in the
-       specified module, or '-a' or '-all' to execute tests in all modules.
+       Use 'ballerina test to execute tests in the current package.
 
        Use 'ballerina test <balfile>' to execute the given Ballerina test file.
               Note that testing single bal files will not work within a Ballerina project.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    Run only the set of tests belonging to group_x in current package.
          
          
            
                    Run only the set of tests belonging to the `group_x` in the current package.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -97,30 +86,27 @@ CONFIG PROPERTIES
 
 
 EXAMPLES
-        Run all tests in the current project.
-           $ ballerina test --all
-
-        Run tests in math module.
-           $ ballerina test math
+        Run all tests in the current package.
+           $ ballerina test
 
-        List all test groups in math module.
-           $ ballerina test --list-groups math
+        List all test groups in the package.
+           $ ballerina test --list-groups
 
-        Run only the set of tests belonging to group_x in current project.
-           $ ballerina test --groups group_x  --all
+        Run only the set of tests belonging to group_x in current package.

commit.message:
Apply suggestions from code review

Co-authored-by: praneesha <praneesha@wso2.com>
